intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: I have returned, Father.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: So you have. Word of your work in Hoshido precedes you, son. What I've heard pleases me. Your efforts to vanquish our enemies will not go unrewarded.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Thank you, Father. There's something else. I bring good tidings. it's about Corrin... He/she has already safely returned to us. Our family is whole again.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Corrin... has returned?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: ...Hello, Father.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: What are you doing here, boy/girl?! Why did you come back?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: F-Father! I...

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Father! How could you say such a thing?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Do you take me for a fool, Corrin? My spies are everywhere. I know you've been at Hoshido castle this whole time. No doubt their filthy queen filled your head with all manner of secrets about your birth. A poor little prince/princess of Hoshido abducted at a young age by the forces of Nohr. You are surely now aware that the royal family of Nohr is your enemy by birthright. Yet you came back, all the same. I can't help but wonder why.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Hmmm... smells like treachery! Betrayal! He's/She's surely sided with the enemy. Could it be he's/she's planning to assassinate you, King Garon? it's only logical...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: NO! How could you say that?! I would never do such a thing!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: It's true. That is simply not possible.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Oh? How can you be so sure? I expect less sentimentality from a future king of Nohr.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: I have proof his/her loyalty still lies with Nohr! Although it was his/her first true battle, he/she fought off the Hoshidan army all alone.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Um, Xander? That's not exactly... argh!

intro.speaker: Leo
intro.line: Be quiet, Corrin. Don't say a word...

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: What's more, I saw him/her elect to return to Nohr with my own eyes. We all did. Because of that choice, Prince Ryoma grew angry and tried to kill Corrin. If he/she were a Hoshidan spy, why would he/she risk his life for us? Why would he alienate himself/herself from the royals by protecting us?

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Hmmm... A convincing story. But it proves nothing. The whole thing could be an elaborate ruse!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Silence Iago! As Crown Prince of Nohr, I swear on my honor that it was no act. You weren't even there, you fool. How could you possibly know what transpired?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: That is enough, Iago. Your words have been heard and considered. Corrin! Where is the sword I gifted you with before you left?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That sword... it broke while I was in Hoshido... it exploded before my eyes. If Mother... I mean, the Hoshidan queen... if she hadn't sacrificed herself to save me, I would have died.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I see... how very touching.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Father...I must ask you something. D-did you give me that sword, knowing this would happen? Was it planned?

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Corrin, I don't think now is the best time to bring that up.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: No, I must know. For myself, and for the innocent Hoshidans who were killed. Father, please tell me the truth. Did you plan that explosion? Did you raise me as your son/child just to send me with that sword to die in Hoshido?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: That sword is just a sword. I know nothing about this attack of which you speak.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: But, Father...

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I gave you my answer, boy/girl! I won't say it again.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Still doubting the King, are you? Those Hoshidans really got under your skin. King Garon. I think it's safe to say we have a dirty Hoshidan spy on our hands...

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Sadly, I must agree. Now that the war between our kingdoms has escalated, I have no choice. I cannot allow this little problem to go any further than it already has. Xander... Kill Corrin. That's an order.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: WHAT?!

intro.speaker: Camilla
intro.line: Father, stop this madness! I beg of you!

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Please, no! Don't hurt our brother/sister!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: That's enough, Princess. It is not your place to question the King's decision. Not even a queen would be able to overrule a direct command from King Garon!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Xander, you have your orders. No more stalling. Proceed.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: I won't do it! I'm sorry, father.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Awww, what's the matter? Don't have the guts?! Or is our own crown prince also a traitor? He IS defying a royal order, after all...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Stop this! Xander is not a traitor. Father... I am the cause of all this. All will be well if I just disappear, correct? Please don't bring Xander into this. I'll do it myself. ... Father?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: So, you're willing to trade your life for his? Fascinating. In that case... I shall allow the great Anankos to decide your fate. Now would be a good time to start praying.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Father? I don't understand...

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Quiet, children. I will now seek the counsel of the sacred mystical dragon, Anankos. He alone shall decide Corrin's fate.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: King Garon? You can't be serious... Are you feeling well?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: The mystical dragon... Anankos?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Mighty Anankos, I call upon your wisdom on this day of reckoning! Grant me a vision... Show me the way... ... ... Understood. It shall be done. Fate has smiled on you today, young Corrin. As decreed by Anankos, you shall be accepted in the Nohrian royal family.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Father, I... Thank you!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: King Garon?! This is preposterous!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: You did the right thing, Father. We are all eternally grateful.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Not so fast. Before it can be done, Corrin must first pass a test.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: A test? What kind of test?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Anankos decrees that you must first suppress the Ice Tribe's rebellion. Once you have gloriously fulfilled that obligation on behalf of Nohr... I will welcome you back into the fold as my son/daughter, and all will be as it was.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Suppress the rebellion... I understand, Father. No matter what, I won't let you down.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: You'll do great, Corrin. I will prepare the troops immediately. With our army at your side, you will make quick work of that little rebellion.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Yeah! You can do it! I'll go along too, so I can heal you if you get hurt!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: You fail to understand the task at hand. To fulfill the wishes of Anankos, he/she must perform this task by himself/herself. Corrin will vanquish the tribe alone, without the help of our troops.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: WHAT?! Father! That's... that's not possible!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Father, be reasonable. Attempting to end this rebellion alone is suicide! To even get there, he/she must first pass through the Woods of the Forlorn. it's too much to ask of him when he's/she's still so inexperienced in the ways of the world!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: If that is so, then kill him/her now. I will not tolerate insolence.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: ... Understood, Father. I apologize for my outburst.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Don't worry Xander. I'll find a way to do this alone... somehow. Do you remember when Leo said I have the Devil's luck? It must be true. I swear to you, I will accomplish this task and return home without fail. If you'll excuse me, I must go make the proper preparations for my journey.

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: Corrin... May the gods be at your side.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I have high hopes for you, Corrin. Do not let me down.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I won't, father. That's a promise.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: Excellent. All is going according to plan. He/she has already left, all alone, just as Anankos ordained. No traitor of Nohr shall escape justice! Even if he/she begs for the sweet release of death, I won't allow it. He/she must first live long enough to lose all hope and learn the true meaning of pain. Ahahaha!

intro.speaker: Xander
intro.line: ...So it is true. I should have known. Father only wishes to make Corrin suffer... in that case, I know what I must do.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: So these are the Woods of the Forlorn... if I can't make it through here, I'll never reach the Ice Tribe village. I... I wonder if I'm even going the right way. I've never had to go it alone like this. It's a lonely feeling.

intro.speaker: Lilith
intro.line: AHEM.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Oh, I'm sorry, Lilith! You're absolutely right - I'm not alone at all. I have you! Thank you for looking after me. Having you here makes me feel a lot better. But enough fooling around. I must fulfill Father's command. Otherwise... Otherwise I betrayed my birth family for nothing. *sigh*

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Wow, it's pitch black in here. This isn't going to be easy, is it? It's so dark, I could be walking in endless circles for all I know. What to do... Lilith? What was that? I think I heard something... Gah! Is that... a faceless?!

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: Grrrrr... Arrgghhh...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I can't believe it! I had no idea there were faceless in this forest. This is bad... I can't run away though. I must make it through here no matter what. That means there's only one option... I'll have to fight my way through!

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: Raaaaaargh!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Wow... s-such power! I'm out of my league. I have no choice... I'll have to use my Dragonstone.

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: Grrraaaaargh!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Dammit! I'm surrounded. I'm in deep trouble now. There's no way I can transform in time.
Aaaaiiiieeeeee!

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: Graaaargh!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: I did it! Oh, thank goodness I arrived in time! Are you OK?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Felicia?! I'm fine, thanks to you. But... what are you doing here?

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: I'm sorry! I was just so worried about you. I had to make sure you were OK. They say the spirits of the dead inhabit this forest, searching for fresh souls to take... That's scary! There was no way I was going to let you face this place all by yourself! It's not easy to do something behind King Garon's back, but I somehow managed. Besides, Flora, Jakob, and I were all moved from the northern fortress to the castle. With both of them around, no one will even notice I'm gone, so it should be fine!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Felicia. It was very kind of you to come after me like you did. But are you sure this is for the best? According to that... that dragon, I have to do this alone or it doesn't count.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Oh! I forgot that part! I am SO STUPID! What are we going to do?! Now you won't be able to pass your test, and it's all my fault!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It's OK, Felicia. Anankos just said I have to beat the Ice Tribe by myself. We're not even there yet, so I bet it's fine. Besides, I'd be dead if it weren't for you!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Oh, Corrin...

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: Grrrraaaargh...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Uh-oh... It looks like we have more company. I hate to ask for your help again so soon, but would you mind lending a hand?

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Of course! After all, that's why I'm here. I refuse to let you die in this horrible place!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Same here. Now let's take these creepy things down and get out of this creepy forest!

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: OK! We can do this!
Hyaaaaa!

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: Graaaargh!

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Begone, vile beast! Corrin, are you OK? Thank heavens I arrived before it was too late!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Jakob?! I'm fine, thanks to you. But... what are you doing here?

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: I apologize for the shock, milady. I was worried sick and just had to check on you. They say the spirits of the dead inhabit this forest, searching for fresh souls to take. I simply could not allow you to face such horrors all by yourself. It's not easy to do something behind King Garon's back, but I managed. In any case, Flora, Felicia and I were all reassigned to the castle after you left. Those two should have no trouble covering for me in my absence, so all should be well.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, Jakob. It was very kind of you to come after me like you did. But are you sure this is for the best? According to that... that dragon, I have to do this alone or it doesn't count.

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: I... I'm so sorry, Corrin. I didn't think through the consequences of my actions. This is all my fault

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It's OK, Jakob. Anankos just said I have to beat the ice tribe by myself. We're not even there yet, so I bet it's fine. Besides, I'd be dead if it weren't for you!

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Thank you, Lady Corrin. It is an honor to serve you.

intro.speaker: Faceless
intro.line: Grrrraaaargh...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Uh-oh... It looks like we have more company. I hate to ask for your help again so soon, but would you mind lending a hand?

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Certainly. You had only to ask. I refuse to let you die in this horrible place.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Same here. Now let's take these creepy things down and get out of this creepy forest!

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: As you wish. Leave it to me!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: They're not backing down. There's no end in sight. I hate to say it Jakob/Felicia, but we're wildly outnumbered here. We need a plan, and fast.

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: Hello? Hellooo?

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Did you hear that? I think someone's calling out to us in the distance...

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: Hey, Corrin! Over here!

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: Phew! I finally caught up with you. You're faster than you used to be.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Um, thanks. And you would be...?

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: It's me, Silas! It's been a long time, Corrin. You're a lot taller! It makes me so happy to reunite with a childhood friend like this.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: A childhood friend? I'm really sorry, but I'm drawing a blank.

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: So you've forgotten about me, eh? Haha, no worries. It's been ages. We used to play together. You always said how badly you wanted to see the world. So one day I made us a picnic and snuck you out for a few hours to explore. I even packed your favorite meal; vegetarian chowder! I knew taking you beyond the walls was forbidden, but... I also knew how much it would mean to you. The guards tried to execute me when we returned, but you wouldn't let them do it.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: No, it can't be... Silas?! Is it really you? Of course I remember you! I can't believe it! It's been a lifetime since I last saw you. You look so different!

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: You too! I wanted to visit, but I was banned from ever returning after that. I became a Nohrian Knight so that one day I might be able to see you again. Now here we are, in the middle of one of your messes! Just like old times, huh? If you will allow me, I would be honored to fight at your side.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Silas... Thank you. You really are a sight for sore eyes.

battle.speaker: Elise
battle.line: Everyone, hold your horses! Corrin, I'm here too!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Elise?! You came as well?

battle.speaker: Elise
battle.line: Heehee, of course! That's what sisters are for, right? No way I was gonna let our new knight come to your rescue without me! I'm here to help you, Corrin! I don't care what Father thinks!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Thank you, Elise... that means so much to me.

battle.speaker: Elise
battle.line: Anyway, back to business. Silas, you're a real dummy, you know that? Mean, too. Leaving a cute princess behind while you forge ahead. Shame on you!

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: I-I'm so sorry, milady! But, um, don't you have your own retainers to look after you?

battle.speaker: Elise
battle.line: Well, yeah, but... Don't change the subject! Speaking of, they should be here soon.

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: So what you're saying is... you left them behind to forge ahead. Right?

battle.speaker: Elise
battle.line: Right!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Elise... you are adorable. Go easy on Silas for me, OK?

battle.speaker: Arthur
battle.line: There's nothing to fear! Arthur is here! The allies of justice have arrived! I'm sorry for letting you slip away, milady. Evil never rests, and nor should I!

battle.speaker: Effie
battle.line: Elise! I was so worried! Thank goodness we found you. Please don't sneak off again - especially when we're all supposed to be resting.

battle.speaker: Elise
battle.line: Heehee, I'm sorry I made you worry. I was just too excited to see Corrin again!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Ah, I finally have the privilege of meeting Elise's retainers. Thank you for coming.

battle.speaker: Arthur
battle.line: Where injustice dwells, you're sure to find me. I can also be found wherever Elise is. I would have gotten here sooner, but I fell in a swamp and then a bird stole my map. Then another bird stole my backup map... Let's just say it was an ordeal.

battle.speaker: Elise
battle.line: Oh, Arthur, that is SO YOU! He has the worst luck, heehee.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: I see... Well, all that matters is that you're here now.

battle.speaker: Effie
battle.line: I didn't fall in the swamp like Arthur, but my armor did hold me back. Maybe I packed too many training stones into it before I left...

battle.speaker: Elise
battle.line: Effie is super strong! She's amazing!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Haha, you seem to have some really special retainers, Elise. With all of you on my side, I know we can make it through this. Thank you, all of you, for putting yourselves at risk to come to my aid.

battle.speaker: Elise
battle.line: Sure thing! But really Xander is the one you should thank. He went behind Father's back and sent us all out here to keep you safe!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Xander... Well, I certainly can't die before thanking him. All the more reason to prevail!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Phew! It appears all of the Faceless have finally been dispatched. Good work.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Yaaay! We did it! GO TEAM!

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: I can't believe we actually won. Amazing! Now to make our way through this forest and head to the Ice Tribe Village.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: it's such a dark forest, though... I hope we don't lose our way.

end.speaker: Felicia
end.line: Oh dear, that's not possible! I can guide us to the village from here. It's where I was born, after all. I could get us there with my eyes closed! I'll keep them open, though... otherwise I'll surely trip.

end.speaker: Jakob
end.line: Worry not, milady. I'm more than happy to guide us from here. I've made it my business to know every inch of our kingdom like the back of my hand.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Felicia/Jakob, you never cease to amaze me. Whenever you're ready, lead the way.

end.speaker: Jakob
end.line: It would be my pleasure. Please, follow me.

end.speaker: Iago
end.line: Drat! So our false prince/princess made it through that battle in one piece... And after I went through all that trouble to summon a Faceless army! This is Prince Xander's fault, the traitor. Though King Garon is not without blame... I don't see why he would allow that child to live after being tainted by the Hoshidans. It is truly beyond my understanding. Luckily he has me to set things right. That's right, Corrin. Enjoy this brief respite, heh heh heh. Hell is waiting for you as soon as you leave this forest. Prepare to suffer and die!
